meanings.sent1: She felt even awkwarder when she tripped in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: The situation became even awkwarder when no one knew how to react.
meanings.sent3: It was awkwarder than expected when the cat knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room grew awkwarder with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: His attempts to dance were even awkwarder than his previous efforts.

meanings.definition: More difficult to use or handle
meanings.sent1: The new software was awkwarder to navigate than the old one.
meanings.sent2: The tools in the shed were becoming awkwarder to find as it got messier.
meanings.sent3: Trying to assemble the furniture became even awkwarder when the instructions were missing.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting became awkwarder to read as she rushed to finish the note.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were getting awkwarder to fit together as she realized some were missing.

meanings.sent1: It was even awkwarder when she realized she had been talking to the wrong person.
meanings.sent2: The situation became awkwarder when he accidentally spilled his drink on her.
meanings.sent3: The timing couldn't have been more awkwarder when her phone rang during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The situation grew awkwarder as they both reached for the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent5: The misunderstanding became even awkwarder when they both tried to explain at the same time.
